intro: Galeopsis micrantha, commonly known as lesser hedge-nettle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North America. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 centimeters and features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are often mistaken for insects due to their shape and color. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Galeopsis micrantha is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance.
